dataIdInfo.idPurp: This feature spatially displays information about water quality in Oregon's rivers and streams based on Oregon’s 2012 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This feature contains a spatial representation of streams and stream segments with water quality information from Oregon’s 2012 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List. This feature should be used in conjunction with the feature Cat_45_Lakes. A water body may have assessment information for multiple pollutants or conditions, and may have multiple data records associated with the spatial representation of the water body or segment of the water body. Oregon’s 2012 Integrated Report Assessment Database and 303(d) List are available on-line at http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/rpt2012/search.asp. The on-line searchable database should be used in conjunction with these features, and is the reference source to verify all attribute information about water quality and to obtain assessment information about water bodies that do not have georeferenced locations. Users may contact DEQ for information about Oregon’s water quality assessment process, additional updates to the 2012 IR, and the schedule for future water quality integrated reports. http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/assessment.htm. A ReadMe file accompanies the geodatabase and users are encouraged to see the document for additional details.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: This data set was assembled by the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, Water Quality Division, Standards and Assessments Section. GIS data prepared by the Watershed Management Section, Drinking Water Program.

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, Water Quality Program

rpCntInfo.cntInstr: For contact on attribute Information: Karla Urbanowicz 503-229-6099

Consts.useLimit: Public data. There are no restrictions on access to the data set. This data set is designed to be used for regulatory purposes by DEQ to prioritize, plan, and develop Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) and water restoration activities, and as an information source for permitting point source and non-point source wastewater dischargers. The data set is available to the public as a reference and for water quality management purposes. DEQ recommends that all users pay careful attention to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The information and data are provided with the understanding that conclusions drawn from such information are the responsibility of the user.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

themeKeys.keyword: Oregon, water quality, water quality assessment, Integrated Report, rivers, streams, 303(d), water quality limited, pollutant, pollution, water quality standards, beneficial uses, impaired water

placeKeys.keyword: Watersheds, Oregon, United States of America, North America, stream segments

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number. An ObjectID is a unique, not null integer field used to uniquely identify rows in tables in a geodatabase. ObjectIDs are limited to 32-bit values, which store a maximum value of 2,147,483,647.
attr.attrdefs: Esri

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Summary of Oregon water quality standard (may be numeric or narrative criteria) used to assess data or information for a pollutant or water condition. See geodatabase tables NumericCriteria and NarrativeCriteria.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon DEQ Water Quality Division

attr.attrdef: Name attributed to a lake in the 1:100,000 hydrography layer. “Unnamed” signifies no attributed name. Local or alternate names may be given in parentheses. NULL field indicates no lake present.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer.

attr.attrdef: The name of the coastal recreation beach used in EPA’s Beach Advisory and Closing On-Line Notification (BEACON) system for reporting pollution incidents for coastal beaches. See geodatabase table CoastalBeaches.
attr.attrdefs: Beach monitoring program, Oregon Public Health Authority, EPA Reach Address Database (RAD)

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for assessment results for a specific record. Unique ID used in WQ Assessment database to describe assessment record.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Name attributed to the water body in the 1:100,000 hydrography layer. When a lake has a through-going stream, both stream name followed by “/” and lake name are given. “Unnamed” signifies no attributed name. Local or alternate names may be given in parentheses.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer.

attr.attrdef: Name attributed to a stream in the 1:100,000 hydrography layer. “Unnamed” signifies no attributed name. Local or alternate names may be given in parentheses. NULL field indicates no through-going stream present.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer.

attr.attrdef: Longitude/Latitude ID (LLID) is a unique 13 digit code assigned to a water body. The code is derived from the longitude (7 decimal degrees) and latitude (6 decimal degrees) at a point at the center of a lake polygon. NULL field indicates no lake present.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer.

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for an assessment unit segment. A segment is a specific location on a water body represented by an LLID and the starting and ending point of the segment measured in river miles.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Longitude/Latitude ID (LLID) is a unique 13 digit code assigned to a water body. The code is derived from the longitude (7 decimal degrees) and latitude (6 decimal degrees) at a point at the mouth of a stream or the center of a lake polygon. When a lake has a through-going stream, both stream LLID followed by “/” and lake LLID are given.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer.

attr.attrdef: Longitude/Latitude ID (LLID) is a unique 13 digit code assigned to a water body. The code is derived from the longitude (7 decimal degrees) and latitude (6 decimal degrees) at a point at the mouth of a stream. NULL field indicates no through-going stream present.
attr.attrdefs: StreamNet 1:100,000 hydrography or alternate 1:24,000 layer

attr.attrdef: The start and end of an assessment unit segment measured in river miles. RM 0 is at the mouth of a stream or the centroid of a lake. Miles are reported as: [River mile start] to [River mile end].
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Unique alphanumeric identifier for a coastal recreation beach used in EPA’s Beach Advisory and Closing On-Line Notification (BEACON) system for reporting pollution incidents for coastal beaches. See geodatabase table CoastalBeaches.
attr.attrdefs: Beach monitoring program, Oregon Public Health Authority, EPA Reach Address Database (RAD)

attr.attrdef: Unique 8 digit code identifying a fourth level classification unit (HUC4 or Hydrologic Unit Code 4) in the national USGS hydrologic unit system. A HUC4 is a Subbasin (formerly called a cataloging unit). The average area of a HUC4 is 703 square miles.
attr.attrdefs: US Geologic Survey, Hydrologic Unit Maps, USGS Water Supply Paper 2294

attr.attrdef: Name assigned to a fourth level classification unit (HUC4 or Hydrologic Unit Code 4 or Subbasin) in the national USGS hydrologic unit system. The name usually relates to a principal hydrologic feature or a cultural or political feature.
attr.attrdefs: US Geologic Survey, Hydrologic Unit Maps, USGS Water Supply Paper 2294

attr.attrdef: Name assigned to a third level classification unit (HUC3 or Hydrologic Unit Code 3 or Basin) in the national USGS hydrologic unit system. The HUC3 code is 6 digits and the average area is 10,596 square miles. The name usually relates to a principal hydrologic feature or a cultural or political feature.
attr.attrdefs: US Geologic Survey, Hydrologic Unit Maps, USGS Water Supply Paper 2294

attr.attrdef: River mile at the end of water body assessment unit segment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for an assessment record with a unique combination of water body location (LLID, RM1, RM2), pollutant parameter, and season.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: The name of chemical or organic wastes, biological and other materials, heat, sediment, and other wastes discharged into water. The presence of pollutants in water may degrade water quality and may impair beneficial uses of the water. See geodatabase table Pollutant.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Total miles in an assessment unit segment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for specific pollutant. See geodatabase table Pollutant.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for a time period when specific water quality criteria apply or when data are grouped to assess seasonal water quality conditions. See geodatabase table Season.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Summary of data and/or information evaluated for the assessment. Field properties limit the size of the summary field and data in some records are truncated. See on-line database for complete summary information. http://www.deq.state.or.us/wq/assessment/rpt2012/search.asp
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Year of Water Quality Assessment Integrated Reporting cycle.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Date of assessment action.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Action taken in a specific cycle of Water Quality Assessment Integrated Reporting. This includes adding new records to the assessment report for water quality conditions in specific waters, or changing the water quality condition reporting status for the record. See geodatabase table Action.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for action taken in a specific cycle of Water Quality Assessment Integrated Reporting. See geodatabase table Action.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for numeric Oregon water quality standard used to assess data or information for a pollutant or water condition. See geodatabase table NumericCriteria.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Beneficial uses protected by water quality standards. See geodatabase table Affected_Use.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Time period when specific water quality criteria apply or when data are grouped to assess seasonal water quality conditions. See geodatabase table Season.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Numeric identifier for the assessment status category for the water quality conditions. See geodatabase table Status. Note: Status_IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 11 and 22 are not used in this assessment database.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Water quality condition at last assessment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Assessment action taken at last assessment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Assessment cycle of last assessment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Information about approved Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) relevant to water body.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: A status category (Category 1 through 5) for the water quality condition for each assessment record based on evaluating water quality information using DEQ’s assessment methodology decision rules. Category 1: Attaining all criteria/uses (Status_ID = 11) Not used by DEQ. Category 2: Attaining some criteria/uses - Specific water quality standards are met. (Status_ID = 12). Category 3: Insufficient data to determine whether a standard is met. (Status_ID =13). Category 3B: Insufficient data, potential concern - Some data indicate non-attainment of a criterion, but data are insufficient to assign another category. (Status_ID =19). Category 4: Insufficient data, potential concern (Status_ID = 20). Category 4A: Water quality limited, TMDL approved - TMDLs needed to attain applicable water quality standards have been approved. (Status_ID =14). Category 4B: Water quality limited, other control measures. Other pollution control requirements are expected to address all pollutants and will attain water quality standards. (Status_ID = 15). Category 4C: Water quality limited, not a pollutant. Impairment is not caused by a pollutant (e.g., flow or lack of flow is not considered a pollutant.) (Status_ID = 16). Category 5: Water quality limited, 303(d) list, TMDL needed. Water is water quality limited and a TMDL is needed per Section 303(d). (Status_ID = 17). Note: Assessments replaced with other records as corrections may be tracked as Status_ID 10, 18, or 21. Water quality limited or impaired waters include both Category 4 and Category 5. (Status ID = 14, 15, 16, 17, and 20). See geodatabase table Status.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Additional information relevant to assessment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: River mile at the start of water body assessment unit segment.
attr.attrdefs: Oregon Dept. of Environmental Quality/Water Quality Program

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units. This value is automatically calculated by the ESRI ArcGIS10 software in a geodatabase.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI, ArcGIS10

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

distorCont.rpOrgName: Oregon Department of Environmental Quality, Water Quality Program

dataLineage.statement:
Every two years, DEQ is required to assess water quality and report to EPA on the condition of Oregon's waters. DEQ prepares an Integrated Report that meets the requirements of the federal Clean Water Act (CWA) for Section 305(b) and Section 303(d).
CWA Section 305(b) requires a report on the overall condition of Oregon's waters. CWA Section 303(d) requires identifying waters that do not meet water quality standards and where a Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL*) needs to be developed. The Integrated Report includes an assessment of each water body where data are available, and the list of waters identified under Section 303(d) as water quality limited and needing a TMDL.

dataSource.srcDesc: Data Source Oregon stream water quality data attached to the 1:100,000 streams layer created by StreamNet (http://www.streamnet.org/online-data/GISData.html#hydro). Where stream segments were not present in the 1:100,000 stream layer, streams segments from the (USGS?)1:24,000 stream layer. In the case where segments were missing or gaps occurred, line work edits were done to provide stream continuity. A "stream" line was added to represent the Pacific ocean coastal boundary. In this case, a fictional latitude/longitude identifier (LLID) was added for GIS spatial and database query purposes. The addition of the coastal boundary necessitated a recalculation of river mile start and end values to correctly display mile values.

prcStep.stepDesc: Line work representing streams were reselected from StreamNet 1:100,000 river reach data files for Oregon for water body segments identified in Oregon's 2012 Integrated Report on water quality. Out of the StreamNet reach data sets ONLY those features in the 2012 Integrated Report are represented in this layer. The attribute scheme was revised for the stream layer to present the information contained in the 2012 Integrated Report records. Changes (additions, removals, modifications) were made to the GIS layers as needed to represent the 2012 Integrated Report information. In the case of the Klamath and Lost rivers, the line work was extended beyond the state boundary to facilitate processing. River mile calculation was based on the direction of stream flow and determination of the beginning and ending point of the line segments.
